subject: Re: [junit] Junit Query
msgSnippet: ... I cannot see what this is supposed to do. In particular, why do you invoke getType(), then entirely ignore the result? Fill in the blank:
messageBody:
kavitha arumugam wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> How to write Junit testcase for this
> Java code:
> * @param opt the name of the option
> * @return the type of this <code>Option</code>
>
> public Object getOptionObject(String opt)
> {
> String res = getOptionValue(opt);
>
> if (!options.containsKey(opt))
> {
> return null;
> }
>
> Object type = ((FAOption)
> options.getopt)).getType();
>
> return res;
> }
>
> please give me the solution for this.I will appreciate
> ur help.

I cannot see what this is supposed to do. In particular, why do you
invoke getType(), then entirely ignore the result?

Fill in the blank:

assertEquals(____, getOptionObject("hello"));
